page.title: 04Housing Association
page.content: {Splott Housing.}A housing stock built between 1875-1914:now in need of comprehensive improvement and repair. 21.2% of houses lacking inside toilet. 16.9% only with the 5 basic amenities. 5.7% of houses statutorily unfit. {Moors Community Housing Association's aim is to improve the environment of Splott by upgrading large numbers of houses in rundown streets.It is a non-profitmaking organisation bearing charitable status.M.C.H.A.has improved 130 houses to date.Many Splott people are of retirement age and need Association homes rather than risk problem of repairing their own.Role therefore to provide decent housing for rent.ON books:2 and 3 bedroomed. houses,1 bed. cottages,1 pers.flats. for rent to people living in poor conditions.Once they have moved to new house {their }house is renovated.
